page.title: 12Broadhempston
page.content: Broadhempston is a beautiful old village with a population of about 400 living mainly in old houses of character or more modern houses and bungalows built to fill in gaps along the main street or in the separate area on the hill known as Houndhead. The village was mentioned in Domesday and has grown up around the church and a valley street with a pub at each end. It has resisted change in its character so a present proposal to build 17 starter homes and 6 Council pensioners' homes is very unpopular. Because of small numbers the church, the school, the single shop and the four times daily bus service to Newton Abbot are always under threat.
